entries.source: Chat Edit: 'Can you help me migrate my waybar code to quickshell? There are some functions I'd like to add to my status bar that just aren't possible with waybar, so I would like to move everything over to quickshell. I currently do not have quickshell installed, and may need to add extensions to my VSCode environment to accomplish this. Can you help?'
Chat Edit: 'Could not find "/home/bryan/.config/quickshell/shell.qml" config directory in any valid config path.'

Chat Edit: 'Got it, thank you! I made a couple more modifications based on that information.

Next, we need to assign commands to the quick access icons.

terminal (kitty) - open kitty
nautilus (files) - open thunar (can we change the name from nautilus to the generic "files" to avoid confusion)
firefox - open firefox
image (wallpaper selector) - open waypaper
screenshot (hyprshot) - open hyprshot-gui
brush (theme-switcher) - open theme-switcher script (~/.local/bin/theme-switcher)

I would also like to change the quick access functionality so that there is only an up chevron ^ icon visible by default, then when clicked, it changes to a right chevron > and the quick access icons slide out like a drawer. Is that doable?'

Chat Edit: 'Everything is clickable now, but we need to assign the commands to the icons in order to launch their specific app or script. 

Terminal - launch kitty
Files - launch thunar
Firefox - launch firefox
Image - launch waypaper
Screenshot - launch hyprshot-gui
Brush - launch ~/.local/bin/theme-switcher.sh'

Chat Edit: 'This works now, but I failed to mention the theme-switch command should be ~/.local/bin/theme-switcher --wofi since I prefer that it use the wofi interface as opposed to cli, but it's scripted to work both ways.'
undoRedo.source

Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately this still didn't launch. I thought maybe it was the way the command was entered with a separated "...theme-switcher.sh", " --wofi" so I change it to "...theme-switcher.sh --wofi" but that also didn't help. I'm not sure why it's not working.'

Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately this still didn't launch. I thought maybe it was the way the command was entered with a separated "...theme-switcher.sh", " --wofi" so I change it to "...theme-switcher.sh --wofi" but that also didn't help. I'm not sure why it's not working.'

Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately this still didn't launch. I thought maybe it was the way the command was entered with a separated "...theme-switcher.sh", " --wofi" so I change it to "...theme-switcher.sh --wofi" but that also didn't help. I'm not sure why it's not working.'

Chat Edit: 'That does bring up the wofi theme switcher UI now, but when I change the theme it is opening an instance of waybar under the quickshell bar, and the quickshell bar is not assuming the correct color palette.

The waybar config and css is at ~/.config/waybar/. The css is updated by the theme-switcher.sh script so if the CSS needs update, it should be updated in the themes switcher script, NOT the style.css file.

The theme color palettes are located in ~/.config/hypr/themes/ and correspond with the theme names in theme-switcher.sh.

I will kill the running waybar process while you are working this out!

'
Chat Edit: 'When I click on the theme-switcher icon in the bar, the old wofi UI opens instead of the quickshell widget--can you fix that?'
Chat Edit: 'When I click on the theme-switcher icon in the bar, the old wofi UI opens instead of the quickshell widget--can you fix that?'

Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately, clicking the icon (which is missing) in the bar does nothing, nor does the keybind Super+T.

I also tried the IPC call and got the following:

archlinux% quickshell ipc call ShellRoot toggleThemeSwitcher
Target not found.
'

Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately, clicking the icon (which is missing) in the bar does nothing, nor does the keybind Super+T.

I also tried the IPC call and got the following:

archlinux% quickshell ipc call ShellRoot toggleThemeSwitcher
Target not found.
'

Chat Edit: 'Unfortunately, clicking the icon (which is missing) in the bar does nothing, nor does the keybind Super+T.

I also tried the IPC call and got the following:

archlinux% quickshell ipc call ShellRoot toggleThemeSwitcher
Target not found.
'
Chat Edit: 'I'm still not seeing anything pop up when the theme button is pressed. I would also like to use the brush icon as opposed to the palette icon for the theme-switcher.'

Chat Edit: 'The brush icon is not appearing as it should. The brush icon should have the class nf-fa-brush, or UTF \uee26.

clicking the icon still does not launch the theme-switcher widget.'

Chat Edit: 'The brush icon is not appearing as it should. The brush icon should have the class nf-fa-brush, or UTF \uee26.

clicking the icon still does not launch the theme-switcher widget.'
Chat Edit: 'There we go--much better! Lastly, we need to figure out why the brush icon for the theme-switcher is still not displaying on the bar next to the screenshot icon.'
Chat Edit: 'There we go--much better! Lastly, we need to figure out why the brush icon for the theme-switcher is still not displaying on the bar next to the screenshot icon.'
